qas.question: Who was the last Ming leader?
How did the Chongzhen Emporer die?

context: Ming government officials fought against each other, against fiscal collapse, and against a series of peasant rebellions. They were unable to capitalise on the Manchu succession dispute and installation of a minor as emperor. In April 1644, the capital at Beijing was sacked by a coalition of rebel forces led by <a0_0>Li Zicheng<a0_0/>, a <a1_0>former minor Ming official<a1_0/>, who established a short-lived <a2_0>Shun<a2_0/> dynasty. The last Ming ruler, the <a3_0>Chongzhen Emperor<a3_0/>, committed <a4_0>suicide<a4_0/> when the city fell, marking the official end of the dynasty.
